Name: St. Andrew's Episcopal Pantry
Description:
Our pantry is an all volunteer food pantry.
We opened in June 2002.
We are open Friday and Saturday from 12:00 to 2:00 PM
Sunday we open at 1:00 and close at 3:00 PM.

You shop for yourself. You may shop every 30 days.
We welcome the working poor.


We CLOSE in ice and snow and most religious and US holidays.

Name: Golden Harvesters, Inc
Description: Golden Harvesters, Inc. provides up to 50 lbs of food 2x a week in exchange for just $20 and 2 hours of volunteer work per month.  The food is predominantly donated by Portland businesses, with some select items purchased at very low cost from the Oregon Food Bank.  Established in 1988, this cooperative is run completely by volunteers and has been helping low income residents of Portland

Name: Waste Not Food Taxi
Description: Businesses can call us when they have excess edible food. We send a volunteer driver to pick it up and deliver it to a nearby pantry or shelter. When there's more than hunger-relief organizations can use, we make it available to the public. Call, email, or text for an appointment, 7 days a week.
Address:
17850 NW Park View Blvd.
Portland, OR 97229

Thursday from 5:00-6:00pm in the DDHS South Cafeteria.  Doors open at 5:00pm

Our school pantry provides families with 50 pounds (3-5 days) of nutritious emergency food to address weekend and evening hunger when other food supports are not available.  The pantry provides fresh produce, frozen meat and vegetables, milk, eggs, grains, and canned goods.

Documentation Required: Proof of residency or ID Hours:Thursday 12:00pm to 3:00pmEveryone is welcome to come and you can come as often as you need to.  Our pantry is in the back parking lot of Christ the King Lutheran Church, 11305 SW Bull Mountain Road, Tigard, Or 97224.

Name: Trinity United Methodist
Description: Provides a food pantry.  Serves Lincoln County. Documentation Required: Proof of address such as a utility bill or rent receipt required at first visit to qualify for food pantry card. Pantry hours: Tuesdays 1pm -3pm and 3rd Tuesday of every month: 6pm -7pm

Name: Yachats Youth And Family Activities Program
Description: Provides a food pantry.  Serves Yachats and surrounding area. Beginning on November 15, people who want to use the pantry or donate to the pantry will need to go into the City office to get a key. For more information about the Yachats Food Pantry, call the Yachats Youth & Family Activities Program.
